instruction: Who are the top 4 in EPL?
context:
The 2000s saw the rise of first Liverpool, and then Arsenal to real competitiveness, Chelsea finally breaking the duopoly by winning in 2004-05. The dominance of the so-called "Top Four" clubs. Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool and Manchester United saw them finish at the top of the table for the bulk of the decade, thereby guaranteeing qualification for the UEFA Champions League. Only three other clubs managed to qualify for the competition during this period: Newcastle United (2001–02 and 2002–03), Everton (2004–05) and Tottenham Hotspur (2009–10) – each occupying the final Champions League spot, with the exception of Newcastle in the 2002–03 season, who finished third.

Following the 2003–04 season, Arsenal acquired the nickname "The Invincibles" as it became the first, and to date, only club to complete a Premier League campaign without losing a single game.

In May 2008, Kevin Keegan stated that "Top Four" dominance threatened the division: "This league is in danger of becoming one of the most boring but great leagues in the world." Premier League chief executive Richard Scudamore said in defence: "There are a lot of different tussles that go on in the Premier League depending on whether you're at the top, in the middle or at the bottom that make it interesting."

Between 2005 and 2012 there was a Premier League representative in seven of the eight Champions League finals, with only "Top Four" clubs reaching that stage. Liverpool (2005), Manchester United (2008) and Chelsea (2012) won the competition during this period, with Arsenal (2006), Liverpool (2007), Chelsea (2008) and Manchester United (2009 and 2011) all losing Champions League finals. Leeds United were the only non-"Top Four" side to reach the semi-finals of the Champions League, in the 2000–01 season. There were three Premier League teams in the Champions League semi-finals in 2006–07, 2007–08, and 2008–09, a feat only ever achieved five times (along with Serie A in 2002–03 and La Liga in 1999–2000).

Additionally, between the 1999–2000 and 2009–10 seasons, four Premier League sides reached UEFA Cup or Europa League finals, with only Liverpool managing to win the competition in 2001. Arsenal (2000), Middlesbrough (2006) and Fulham (2010) all lost their finals.

Although the group's dominance was reduced to a degree after this period with the emergence of Manchester City and Tottenham, in terms of all-time Premier League points won they remain clear by some margin. As of the end of the 2021–22 season – the 27th season of the Premier League – Liverpool, in fourth place in the all-time points table, were over 300 points ahead of the next team, Tottenham Hotspur. They are also the only teams to maintain a winning average of over 50% throughout their entire Premier League tenures.
response: Arsenal, Liverpool, Manchester United and Chelsea are know as the "Top Four" in the English Premier league.
generated_response:
Based on the text, the top four clubs in the English Premier League (EPL) during the 2000s were:

1. Arsenal
2. Chelsea
3. Liverpool
4. Manchester United

These teams dominated the league during this period, with only three other clubs managing to qualify for the UEFA Champions League: Newcastle United, Everton, and Tottenham Hotspur. The top four clubs were known as the "Top Four," and their dominance was criticized by Kevin Keegan in 2008, who called the league "one of the most boring but great leagues in the world." However, despite the emergence of Manchester City and Tottenham Hotspur in recent years, the top four clubs remain clear leaders in terms of all-time Premier League points won.

instruction: Please summarize from this text what were the main reasons Czech people immigrated to Texas.
context: Czech immigration was driven by the availability of land in Texas and by events in Europe. In the 1840s, the Austrian Empire, which included Czech lands, was still run by a feudal system, despite the wave of democratic ideals permeating western Europe. This led to the Revolutions of 1848, which did little to improve the economic status of peasants who still found it difficult to gain wealth. The revolutions, together with factors such as religious persecution and mandatory military service, fueled a wave of emigration from Austria beginning in 1852. Immigrants to America were unfamiliar with the concept of American democracy due to their lack of experience with democratic ideals. The concepts of states' rights and slavery were equally foreign to the immigrants.
response: Czech immigration to Texas in the 19th century was influenced by the availability of land in Texas to homestead, economic opportunity, freedom from religious persecution and to escape the revolutions in the Austrian empire that lead to political unrest and economic uncertainty in the region.
generated_response:
Of course! Based on the text, the main reasons Czech people immigrated to Texas were:

1. Availability of land in Texas
2. Events in Europe, such as the Revolutions of 1848 and religious persecution
3. Economic difficulties for peasants under the feudal system in Austria.

instruction: Please provide details on  Brisbane International tournament with given text as a reference
context:
The Brisbane International established in 2009 is a professional tennis tournament played on outdoor hardcourts in Brisbane, Queensland in Australia. It is a WTA Premier tournament of the WTA Tour and was part of the ATP World Tour 250 series of the ATP World Tour until 2019, when it was dropped from the ATP Tour.

The tournament is held annually in January at the Queensland Tennis Centre just before the first Grand Slam tournament of the season, the Australian Open (part of the Australian Open Series). It is owned by Tennis Australia.
response:
1. The Brisbane International, which began in 2009, is an outdoor hardcourt professional tennis competition held in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.
2. It is a WTA Premier competition on the WTA Tour, and up until 2019, it was a part of the ATP World Tour 250 series on the ATP World Tour.
3. The competition is conducted each year in January at the Queensland Tennis Center, right before the season's first Grand Slam event, the Australian Open. (part of the Australian Open Series).
4. Tennis Australia is the owner.
generated_response:
Sure, here are the details on the Brisbane International tennis tournament based on the given text:

1. Location: The Brisbane International is held at the Queensland Tennis Centre in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.
2. Established: The tournament was established in 2009.
3. Type: It is a professional tennis tournament played on outdoor hardcourts.
4. WTA Category: The tournament is a WTA Premier tournament of the WTA Tour.
5. ATP World Tour Category: Until 2019, it was part of the ATP World Tour 250 series of the ATP World Tour.
6. Date: The tournament is held annually in January just before the first Grand Slam tournament of the season, the Australian Open (part of the Australian Open Series).
7. Owner: The tournament is owned by Tennis Australia.

instruction: With the given passage as a reference, write some details about Popelogan River
context:
The Popelogan River is a tributary of the Eastern shore Upsalquitch River, flowing particularly through the Addington Parish, in Restigouche County, in the Northwest the New Brunswick, in Canada.

In his course to the south, the Popelogan river flows through a valley increasingly deep in the mountainous terrain. Its main tributaries are the Gordon Brook and the "Lake Popelogan Branch" which supplies at Popelogan Lake. A forest road serves the upper part of the river, from Popelogan Depot.
response:
1. The Popelogan River is a tributary of the Upsalquitch River on the eastern shore of Canada's New Brunswick, mainly passing through the Addington Parish in Restigouche County.
2. The Popelogan river travels through a valley in the steep terrain that gets deeper as it moves south. The Gordon Brook and the "Lake Popelogan Branch," which supplies Popelogan Lake, are its principal tributaries.
3. Popelogan Depot provides access to the upper half of the river via a woodland road.
generated_response:
Sure! Based on the given passage, here are some details about the Popelogan River:

1. Location: The Popelogan River is located in Restigouche County, New Brunswick, Canada, and flows through the Addington Parish.
2. Tributaries: The river has two main tributaries - Gordon Brook and the "Lake Popelogan Branch" which supplies Popelogan Lake.
3. Valley depth: The Popelogan River flows through a valley that becomes increasingly deep as it flows south through mountainous terrain.
4. Forest road access: An forest road serves the upper part of the river, starting from Popelogan Depot.
5. Geographic features: The river is located in a mountainous region and flows through a deep valley, indicating a rugged and scenic landscape.

instruction: Who was Tap Gordon Jones?
context: Air Marshal Sir Edward “Tap” Gordon Jones, KCB, CBE, DSO, DFC (31 August 1914 – 20 February 2007) was an officer in the Royal Air Force for 34 years, from 1935 to 1969. He commanded a squadron of obsolescent biplane Gladiator fighters during the Greek Campaign in the Second World War, where he shot down five Italian Fiat CR.42 fighters. He served in mainly operational posts in Europe until he retired. Unusually, he never served a post in the Air Ministry or the UK Ministry of Defence.
response: Tap Gordon Jones, full name Air Marshal Sir Edward "Tap" Gordon Jones, KCB, CBE, DSO, DFC was an officer in the UK Royal Air Force from 1935 to 1969.  He commanded a squadron of Gladiators during the Greek Campaign in Wold War II.  At the time Gladiators were considered to be obsolete.  During the Greek Campaign, he shot down Five Italian fighters.  After the war until his retirement he mainly served in operational posts in Europe.
generated_response: Based on the provided context, Tap Gordon Jones was an Air Marshal in the Royal Air Force who served for 34 years from 1935 to 1969. He commanded a squadron of Gladiator fighters during the Greek Campaign in World War II and shot down five Italian Fiat CR.42 fighters. He served in operational posts in Europe but never served in the Air Ministry or the UK Ministry of Defence.

instruction: Where does the name Busan (city in Korea) come from?
context: The name "Busan" is the Revised Romanization of the city's Korean name since the late 15th century. It officially replaced the earlier McCune-Reischauer romanization Pusan in 2000. During the Japanese period it was spelled "Fuzan".  The name 釜山 (now written 부산 using the Korean alphabet) is Sino-Korean for "Cauldron Mountain", believed to be a former name of Mt Hwangryeong (황령산, 荒嶺山, Hwangryeong-san) west of the city center. The area's ancient state Mt Geochil (거칠산국, 居柒山國, Geochilsan-guk, "Rough-Mountain Land") is similarly thought to refer to the same mountain, which towers over the town's harbor on the Suyeong. (The later Silla district of Geochilsan-gun was renamed Dongnae in 757.)
response: "Busan" is the romanization of the city's Korean name - 부산.  Previously, the name was romanized as "Pusan" until it was officially replaced in 2000.  The meaning of the name in Sino-Korean is "Cauldron Mountain", believed to be the former name of a nearby mountain now known as Mt Hwangryeong (황령산).
generated_response: The name "Busan" is derived from the Korean name "釜山" (bu-san), which means "Cauldron Mountain". This name is believed to refer to Mt Hwangryeong, a mountain located west of the city center. The name has been used since the late 15th century and was officially adopted in 2000 as the Revised Romanization of the city's name. During the Japanese period, the city was spelled "Fuzan".

instruction: Provide a bulleted summary of the history of Twitter
context:
Twitter is an online social media and social networking service owned and operated by American company Twitter, Inc., on which users post or reply to texts, images and videos known as "tweets". Registered users can tweet, like, "retweet" tweets and direct message (DM), while unregistered users only have the ability to view public tweets. Users interact with Twitter through browser or mobile frontend software, or programmatically via its APIs.

Twitter was created by Jack Dorsey, Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams in March 2006 and launched in July of that year. Twitter, Inc. is based in San Francisco, California and has more than 25 offices around the world. By 2012, more than 100 million users tweeted 340 million tweets a day, and the service handled an average of 1.6 billion search queries per day. In 2013, it was one of the ten most-visited websites and has been described as "the SMS of the Internet". By the start of 2019, Twitter had more than 330 million monthly active users. In practice, the vast majority of tweets are tweeted by a minority of users. In 2020, it was estimated that approximately 48 million accounts (15% of all accounts) were fake.

On October 27, 2022, business magnate Elon Musk acquired Twitter, Inc. for US$44 billion, gaining control of the platform. On December 20, 2022, Musk announced he would step down as CEO once a replacement had been found. As of April 2023, Musk has yet to announce a successor and remains CEO
response:
- Twitter was created by Jack Dorsey, Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams in March 2006
- Twitter reached more than 100 million users in 2012
- Twitter reached more than 330 million users in 2019
- In 2022, Elon Must acquired Twitter for $44B
generated_response:
Here is a bulleted summary of the history of Twitter:

* March 2006: Twitter was created by Jack Dorsey, Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams.
* July 2006: Twitter was launched.
* 2012: More than 100 million users tweeted 340 million tweets per day, and the service handled an average of 1.6 billion search queries per day.
* 2013: Twitter became one of the ten most-visited websites and was described as "the SMS of the Internet".
* 2019: Twitter had more than 330 million monthly active users.
* 2020: Approximately 48 million accounts (15% of all accounts) were estimated to be fake.
* October 27, 2022: Business magnate Elon Musk acquired Twitter, Inc. for US$44 billion, gaining control of the platform.
* December 20, 2022: Musk announced he would step down as CEO once a replacement had been found.
* April 2023: Musk remains CEO and has yet to announce a successor.

instruction: Who is Vincent Paterson?
context: Vincent Paterson (born May 4, 1950) is an American director and choreographer who has had an expansive career in many parts of the entertainment industry including film, Broadway, concert tours, opera, music videos, television and commercials. He has achieved success worldwide as a director and choreographer.
response:
Vincent Paterson (born May 4, 1950) is an American director and choreographer who has had an expansive career in many parts of the entertainment industry including film, Broadway, concert tours, opera, music videos, television and commercials. He has achieved success worldwide as a director and choreographer.
Paterson collaborated with Michael Jackson, George Harrison and Madonna on various projects, including directing and choreographing Madonna's Blond Ambition Tour, the centerpiece for the documentary Madonna: Truth or Dare (also known as In Bed with Madonna outside of North America). He created Madonna's "Marie Antoinette/Vogue" performance for the MTV Awards and her appearance on the Academy Awards. He also choreographed Madonna in the film Evita (1996). For Michael Jackson, he is one of the two fighter dancers in "Beat It" videoclip, and was assistant choreographer and a zombie dancer in "Thriller". He co-directed and co-choreographed Jackson's Bad tour as well as co-choreographing Jackson music videos "Smooth Criminal", "The Way You Make Me Feel", "Dirty Diana", "Speed Demon", "Black or White" and live performances for the Super Bowl XXVII Halftime show, the Grammys, and the MTV 10th Anniversary. He also co-directed and co-choreographed the music video for Jackson's hit "Blood on the Dance Floor".
generated_response: Vincent Paterson is an American director and choreographer who has had a successful career in various parts of the entertainment industry, including film, Broadway, concert tours, opera, music videos, television, and commercials. He was born on May 4, 1950, and has achieved worldwide success as both a director and choreographer.

instruction: List the club sports teams that Neumann University has
context:
Neumann University is a member of the Atlantic East Conference as well as the United Collegiate Hockey Conference (UCHC). It competes in the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA), Division III. In 2009 Neumann University's men's ice hockey team won the NCAA Division III National Championship. In the summer of 2012, Neumann University constructed the Mirenda Center, a 72,000 square foot athletic complex which houses an indoor track, NCAA Division III regulation basketball court, dance studios, student lounges, a classroom, weight and cardio rooms as well as the Center for Sport Spirituality and Character Development.

Neumann sponsors 12 women's athletic teams and 10 men's teams. In addition the 22 varsity teams, Neumann University also has a very active club sports roster which includes baseball, basketball, cheer leading, a dance team, ice hockey, roller hockey as well as men's and women's rugby. Most recently, Neumann University won back to back national championships (2015 and 2016) as part of the National Collegiate Roller Hockey Association (NCHRA).
response:
Based off of the shared information, Neumann University has the following club sports teams:

* baseball
* basketball
* cheer leading
* a dance team
* ice hockey
* roller hockey
* men's rugby
* women's rugby

Note that this may not be a fully exhaustive list.
generated_response:
Based on the information provided, here are the club sports teams that Neumann University has:

1. Baseball
2. Basketball
3. Cheerleading
4. Dance Team
5. Ice Hockey
6. Men's Roller Hockey
7. Women's Rugby
8. Men's Rugby

Note that the list only includes club sports teams, and does not include varsity teams or intramural sports.

instruction: For the Zodiac sign Aries, Share some information from the given text.
context: Aries (♈︎) (Greek: Κριός, romanized: Kriós, Latin for "ram") is the first astrological sign in the zodiac, spanning the first 30 degrees of celestial longitude (0°≤ λ <30°), and originates from the Aries constellation. Under the tropical zodiac, the Sun transits this sign from approximately March 21 to April 19 each year. This time duration is exactly the first month of the Solar Hijri calendar (Arabic Hamal/Persian Farvardin/Pashto Wray).

4.	This time period is exactly the first month of the Solar Hijri calendar (Arabic Hamal/Persian Farvardin/Pashto Wray).
generated_response:
Sure! Here's some information about Aries based on the given text:

* Aries is the first astrological sign in the zodiac and spans the first 30 degrees of celestial longitude (0°≤ λ <30°).
* The Sun transits this sign from approximately March 21 to April 19 each year.
* Aries originates from the Aries constellation.

instruction: Given this paragraph about Drangajökull, tell me where it's located.
context: Drangajökull (pronounced [ˈtrauŋkaˌjœːkʏtl̥], regionally also [ˈtraŋk-]) is the northernmost glacier of Iceland. It is situated southwest of the peninsula Hornstrandir in the Westfjords region. The glacier covers an area of 160–200 km2 (62–77 sq mi), at an altitude of up to 925 m (3,035 ft). It is the only Icelandic glacier which lies entirely below an altitude of 1000 metres and also the only one that has not shrunk in recent years.
response: Drangajökull is located in Iceland in the Westfjords region.
generated_response: Sure! Based on the context, Drangajökull is located in the Westfjords region of Iceland.

instruction: How old were the indigenous civilizations in Mexico prior to European contact?
context: Human presence in Pre-Columbian Mexico goes back to 8,000 BCE and it went to become one of the world's six cradles of civilization. In particular, the Mesoamerican region was home to many intertwined civilizations, including the Olmec, Maya, Zapotec, Teotihuacan, and Purepecha. Last were the Aztecs, who dominated the region in the century before European contact. In 1521, the Spanish Empire and its indigenous allies conquered the Aztec Empire from its capital Tenochtitlan (now Mexico City), establishing the colony of New Spain.
response: There were many civilizations that came prior to European contact, some that date back as early as 8,000 BCE. The last civilization to dominate Mexico a century prior to European contact were the Aztecs, whose capital, Tenochtitlan, became what is now Mexico City.
generated_response: The indigenous civilizations in Mexico prior to European contact were approximately 8,000 years old, dating back to 8,000 BCE. These civilizations, including the Olmec, Maya, Zapotec, Teotihuacan, and Purepecha, had developed complex societies, cultures, and technologies, and were thriving in the region before the arrival of European explorers.

instruction: What exactly was the action of 12 December 1782
context: The action of 12 December 1782 was a naval engagement fought off the coast of Spain near Ferrol, in which the British 40-gun fifth rate HMS Mediator successfully attacked a convoy of five armed ships. Mediator succeeded in capturing one American privateer, the Alexander, and then captured the French ex-ship of the line La Ménagère. The convoy was part of Pierre Beaumarchais's supply chain to the American colonists.
response:
The action of 12 December 1782 was a naval engagement fought off the coast of Spain near Ferrol, in which the British 40-gun fifth rate HMS Mediator successfully attacked a convoy of five armed ships. 

Mediator succeeded in capturing one American privateer, the Alexander, and then captured the French ex-ship of the line La Menagere. The convoy was part of Pierre Beaumarchais's supply chain to the American colonists.
generated_response: The action of 12 December 1782 refers to a naval engagement that took place off the coast of Spain near Ferrol, in which the British ship HMS Mediator successfully attacked and captured several armed vessels as part of Pierre Beaumarchais's supply chain to the American colonists during the American Revolutionary War.

instruction: Given a reference text about Stanley Franklin Browne, how many aerial victories during World War II did he have and what did he do when he returned from the war.
context:
Stanley Franklin Browne, DFC & Bar (29 October 1919 – 13 January 2011) was a New Zealand flying ace of the Royal New Zealand Air Force (RNZAF) during the Second World War. He was officially credited with at least five aerial victories.

Born in Wellington, Browne was a university student when he joined the RNZAF in March 1941. Once his flight training in New Zealand was completed, he proceeded to the United Kingdom to serve with the Royal Air Force. He was posted to No. 485 Squadron in early 1942 but was shot down later in the year over Germany-occupied France. With the help of the French Resistance he avoided the Germans and made his way to the south of France. He was caught when crossing the border into Vichy France and was interned for several weeks. He escaped captivity and eventually back to the United Kingdom. He was transferred to the Middle East where he ferried aircraft before being posted to No. 93 Squadron. He flew Supermarine Spitfires in the Tunisian campaign and in the Allied invasion of Sicily, shooting down a number of German aircraft before being rested in December 1943. After a spell on instructing duties he returned to operational flying with No. 485 Squadron during the final stages of the war in Europe. He briefly commanded the squadron before it was disbanded in August 1945.

Returning to civilian life after the war, he returned to his university studies, becoming a chemist. He briefly served in the New Zealand Territorial Air Force and later became a farmer and then a teacher. He died in 2011, aged 91, at Tauranga.
response: Stanley Franklin Browne was credited with five aerial victories during World War II. After the war, he returned to university and became a chemist.
generated_response:
Sure! Based on the given text, here are the answers to your questions:

1. How many aerial victories did Stanley Franklin Browne have during World War II?
Answer: At least five.
2. What did he do when he returned from the war?
Answer: He returned to civilian life and resumed his university studies, becoming a chemist. He also briefly served in the New Zealand Territorial Air Force and later became a farmer and teacher before dying in 2011 at the age of 91.

instruction: From the passage provided, extract the difference in caffeine between a light roast and a dark roast.
context: Sucrose is rapidly lost during the roasting process, and may disappear entirely in darker roasts. During roasting, aromatic oils and acids weaken, changing the flavor; at 205 °C (401 °F), other oils start to develop. One of these oils, caffeol, is created at about 200 °C (392 °F), which is largely responsible for coffee's aroma and flavor. The difference of caffeine content between a light roast and a dark roast is only about 0.1%.
response: Light roasts and dark roasts differ in caffeine content by about 0.1%.
generated_response: The passage states that the difference in caffeine content between a light roast and a dark roast is only about 0.1%.

instruction: During which decade did neural networks first lead to practically useful systems?
context: The development of metal–oxide–semiconductor (MOS) very-large-scale integration (VLSI), in the form of complementary MOS (CMOS) technology, enabled increasing MOS transistor counts in digital electronics. This provided more processing power for the development of practical artificial neural networks in the 1980s. From 1988 onward, the use of neural networks transformed the field of protein structure prediction, in particular when the first cascading networks were trained on profiles (matrices) produced by multiple sequence alignments.
response: The development of metal–oxide–semiconductor (MOS) very-large-scale integration (VLSI), in the form of complementary MOS (CMOS) technology, enabled the development of practical artificial neural networks in the 1980s
generated_response: The decade during which neural networks first led to practically useful systems was the 1980s.

instruction: How to bake the perfect flourless cheesecake?
response:
1. Assemble the following ingredients: 500 gm quark, mascarpone cheese 250gm (alternatively cream cheese 420gm and heavy cream 200gm), 3 eggs, 2 egg yolks, 50gm sugar, lemon juice 10gm (2 teaspoons). Make sure that all ingredients are at room temperature.
2. Crack the eggs and whisk them until they form a smooth mixture. Don't overdo it.
3. In a mixing bowl, add the quark, mascarpone cheese and sugar. Mix till it is well incorporated. Then gradually add the whisked eggs. 
4. Whisk the mixture while adding the lemon juice. You may add a flavouring essence of your choice, such as vanilla. Blend everything well.
5. Preheat the oven at 210 degree Celsius.
6. Apply butter on the inner sides and bottom of the baking tin and stick butter paper or baking paper to cover all inner surfaces.
7. Pour the batter prepared in step 4 into the baking tin and put the tin in the preheated oven
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the top of the cheesecake is burnt to a shade of brown.
9. Remove the baking tin from the oven and let it cool down in open air
10. Once cooled, chill the cheesecake in the fridge overnight for then best taste and texture. However it can also be enjoyed without refrigerating.
generated_response:
Baking the perfect flourless cheesecake can be a challenging task, but with the right techniques and ingredients, you can create a delicious and creamy dessert that will impress your guests. Here are some tips to help you bake the perfect flourless cheesecake:

1. Choose the right ingredients: A good flourless cheesecake should have a rich, creamy texture, so it's important to use high-quality ingredients like heavy cream, butter, and a mix of soft and sharp cheeses.
2. Preheat your oven: Preheating your oven to the right temperature is crucial for baking a perfect flourless cheesecake. The ideal temperature range is between 350°F (175°C) and 400°F (200°C).
3. Use a water bath: A water bath helps to regulate the temperature of your oven and ensures that your cheesecake cooks evenly. You can use a baking sheet or a springform pan as a water bath.
4. Don't overmix the batter: Overmixing the batter can result in a dense and dry cheesecake. Mix the ingredients just until they are combined, then stop.
5. Bake slowly: Bake your cheesecake at a low temperature (around 325°F or 160°C) for a longer period of time (around 45-50 minutes). This will help the cheesecake cook evenly and prevent it from cracking.
6. Use a gentle touch: When you're baking a flourless cheesecake, it's important to be gentle when handling the batter. Avoid any vigorous mixing or stirring, as this can cause the cheesecake to collapse or develop cracks.
7. Don't open the oven door too often: Opening the oven door too often can cause the cheesecake to sink or develop cracks. Try to limit your visits to the oven to check on the cheesecake.
8. Use a springform pan: A springform pan is ideal for baking flourless cheesecakes, as it allows for easy release of the cheesecake once it's cooked.
9. Don't overbake: The perfect flourless cheesecake should be set and slightly jiggly in the center. Overbaking can cause the cheesecake to dry out and become too firm.
10. Cool slowly: Once your cheesecake is baked, let it cool slowly in the oven for 1-2 hours before removing it. This will help the cheesecake set properly and prevent it from cracking.

By following these tips, you can bake a perfect flourless cheesecake that's creamy, smooth, and delicious. Good luck!

instruction: What are some weird ways I can cut my grass?
response:
If you aren't using a lawnmower to cut your grass, here are some weird ideas to keep your grass trimmed:

- Buy a goat and leave it in your yard
- Spend all day cutting each blade with some craft scissors
- Flamethrower
- Dress up like the grim reaper and use a scythe
generated_response:
Sure, here are some unconventional methods for cutting your grass:

1. Use a remote-controlled lawnmower: If you have a small to medium-sized lawn, consider investing in a remote-controlled lawnmower. These devices allow you to cut your grass from the comfort of a chair or even from a distance, using a remote control.
2. Attach a weed whacker to your bike: If you have a bicycle and a small lawn, you can attach a weed whacker to your bike and pedal around to cut your grass. This method is eco-friendly, cost-effective, and provides exercise.
3. Use a hover mower: A hover mower is a unique type of lawnmower that floats above the ground, using air flow to cut the grass. These mowers are usually battery-powered and can be more efficient than traditional lawnmowers.
4. Hire a goat grazing service: If you have a large lawn or a lot of property, consider hiring a goat grazing service. Goats are natural lawn mowers and can efficiently trim your grass without using any gasoline or electricity.
5. Use a robotic lawnmower: Robotic lawnmowers are becoming increasingly popular and can be programmed to cut your grass on their own. These devices are usually equipped with sensors that allow them to avoid obstacles and navigate around your property.
6. Cut your grass with scissors: If you have a small area of grass, you can use scissors to cut it. This method is time-consuming but can be effective for small areas or for cutting specific sections of your lawn.
7. Use a lawnmower with a built-in cooler: If you plan on cutting your grass during hot summer days, consider using a lawnmower with a built-in cooler. This will help keep you hydrated and comfortable while working outside.
8. Cut your grass with a swing blade mower: A swing blade mower is a type of lawnmower that uses a curved blade to cut the grass. These mowers are usually more efficient than traditional lawnmowers and can be easier to maneuver around obstacles.
9. Attach a leaf blower to your lawnmower: If you have a lot of leaves on your lawn, consider attaching a leaf blower to your lawnmower. This will allow you to cut your grass and blow away the leaves at the same time.
10. Use a solar-powered lawnmower: A solar-powered lawnmower is an eco-friendly option that uses solar panels to charge its battery. These mowers are usually more expensive than traditional lawnmowers but can be a great investment for those looking to reduce their carbon footprint.

Remember, these methods may not be suitable for everyone and may require some experimentation to find what works best for your specific needs and property size.

instruction: Give me a list of five languages which I should make my kids learn.
response: Bengali, Hindi, English, Spanish, French
generated_response:
. Sure, here are five languages that are great for kids to learn, along with reasons why they're valuable:

1. Spanish: As the second most widely spoken language in the world, Spanish is an excellent choice for kids to learn. Not only will it help them communicate with millions of people around the globe, but it's also a beautiful and expressive language that can enrich their minds and cultural understanding. Plus, with many countries in Central and South America speaking Spanish, it's an excellent language to learn for those interested in travel or international business.

2. Mandarin Chinese: As the most widely spoken language globally, Mandarin Chinese is a valuable skill for any child to have. With China's growing economic and political influence worldwide, knowledge of Chinese can open doors to new opportunities and understanding of different cultures. Additionally, learning Chinese can improve cognitive abilities due to its unique writing system and grammatical structures.

3. Arabic: As one of the oldest living languages in the Middle East, Arabic is an essential language for kids interested in history, culture, or international relations. With over 420 million speakers worldwide, it's a valuable skill that can connect them to diverse communities and help them understand Islamic cultures and traditions.

4. French: As the official language of many countries in Europe, Africa, and Canada, French is an excellent choice for kids who love languages and culture. It's known for its beauty, grace, and nuance, making it a great option for developing strong communication skills and an appreciation for diverse cultures. Additionally, France has a rich history of art, literature, and cuisine, which can expose children to new ideas and perspectives.

5. Japanese: With its unique writing system and complex grammar structures, Japanese is an excellent language for kids who enjoy problem-solving and critical thinking. Not only will it help them understand the culture of Japan, but also appreciate its rich history in technology, innovation, and art. Additionally, as a relatively challenging language to learn, mastering Japanese can give your child an edge when it comes to developing their cognitive skills and perseverance.

instruction: Give me a list of top unicorns from India.
response: Flipkart, Swiggy, Ola, Meesho, Cred, Dream11, Paytm, Zomato
generated_response:
Sure, here are some of the top unicorns from India, based on their current valuation and market reputation:

1. Flipkart - Valued at over $20 billion, Flipkart is one of the largest e-commerce platforms in India. It was founded in 2007 by Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal, and was acquired by Walmart in 2018.
2. Paytm - Valued at over $15 billion, Paytm is a mobile payments and digital wallets company founded in 2010 by Vijay Shekhar Sharma. It has expanded into various areas such as e-commerce, online banking, and even movie ticket bookings.
3. Ola - Valued at over $5 billion, Ola is a ride-hailing platform founded in 2011 by Bhavish Aggarwal and Ankit Bhati. It operates in over 100 cities across India and has expanded into other countries such as Australia and the UK.
4. Zomato - Valued at over $3 billion, Zomato is a food delivery and restaurant discovery platform founded in 2008 by Deepinder Goyal and Pankaj Chaddah. It operates in over 20 countries and has expanded into areas such as online ordering and delivery for restaurants.
5. Byju's - Valued at over $2 billion, Byju's is an education technology company founded in 2011 by Raveendran B and Divya Gokulnath. It offers a range of educational products and services such as online courses, interactive learning videos, and mock tests for students.
6. Grofers - Valued at over $1 billion, Grofers is an e-commerce platform for groceries and other daily essentials founded in 2013 by Saurabh Kumar and Albinder Dhindsa. It operates in over 30 cities across India and has expanded into areas such as fashion and electronics.
7. PolicyBazaar - Valued at over $1 billion, PolicyBazaar is an online insurance and financial services platform founded in 2008 by Yashish Dahiya and Alok Bansal. It offers a range of insurance products such as health, life, and car insurance, as well as financial products like loans and credit cards.
8. FirstCry - Valued at over $1 billion, FirstCry is an e-commerce platform for baby and maternity products founded in 2010 by Amit Singh and Supam Maheshwari. It operates in over 300 cities across India and has expanded into areas such as online doctor consultations and baby care services.
9. ShopClues - Valued at over $1 billion, ShopClues is an e-commerce platform founded in 2011 by Sandeep Aggarwal and Radhika Aggarwal. It operates in over 50 categories such as fashion, electronics, and home appliances, and has expanded into areas such as digital payments and logistics.
10. Practo - Valued at over $500 million, Practo is a healthcare technology company founded in 2013 by Shashank ND and Abhinav Lal. It offers a range of services such as online doctor consultations, appointment booking, and medical record management for patients and doctors.

instruction: Give me three festive holiday meals I could serve to my family for Christmas
response:
Here are 3 festive meals for the holidays:
* Prime Rib and Yorkshire Pudding is very traditional
* Turkey, mashed potatoes, cranberries and stuffing are a colorful and delicious American tradition
* Leg of lamb with mint sauce is also a cheerful option
generated_response:
Sure! Here are three festive holiday meals you could serve your family for Christmas:

1. Roasted Turkey with All the Trimmings: A classic Christmas dish, roasted turkey is a crowd-pleaser and can be served with a variety of side dishes such as mashed potatoes, stuffing, and cranberry sauce. Don't forget to save room for pumpkin pie!

2. Prime Rib with Horseradish Cream Sauce: A juicy prime rib is the centerpiece of this festive holiday meal. Serve it with a rich horseradish cream sauce and roasted vegetables like Brussels sprouts or carrots.

3. Baked Salmon with Saffron Rice and Garlic Mashed Potatoes: For a lighter Christmas meal, try baked salmon with a flavorful saffron rice and garlic mashed potatoes. This dish is perfect for a more intimate gathering or for those looking for a healthier holiday option.

Each of these meals offers something unique and delicious for your family to enjoy on Christmas day. You can also add festive touches like holly-garnished rolls or candy cane-shaped roast beef to make the meal even more special. Bon appetit!

instruction: Give me a list of popular current artists in the EDM category.
response: Currently popular musicians in the EDM, or electronic dance music, genre of music include Illenium, 3LAU, Calvin Harris, Kaskade, and Dimitri Vegas.
generated_response:
Sure, here's a list of popular current artists in the EDM (Electronic Dance Music) category based on recent chart performances and festival lineups:

1. Calvin Harris - He has been one of the most successful EDM artists for over a decade, with hits like "Slide" and "One Kiss".
2. The Chainsmokers - This duo has had a string of chart-topping hits like "Closer" and "Don't Let Me Down".
3. Marshmello - Known for his upbeat and joyful tracks like "Happier" and "Alone", Marshmello has become a fan favorite in the EDM scene.
4. Martin Garrix - As one of the youngest artists on this list, Martin Garrix has already had a huge impact on the EDM scene with hits like "Animals" and "In the Name of Love".
5. Tiesto - A pioneer in the trance genre, Tiesto has branched out into other styles like progressive house and pop, with collaborations like "Secrets" and "Red Lights".
6. Zedd - This Russian-German producer has had a diverse range of hits like "Clarity" and "The Middle", showcasing his versatility in the EDM scene.
7. Daft Punk - Although they have been on hiatus for a few years, Daft Punk's influence on the EDM scene cannot be denied, with classic tracks like "One More Time" and "Get Lucky".
8. Avicii - Although he passed away in 2018, Avicii's legacy lives on through his iconic tracks like "Wake Me Up" and "Levels".
9. Skrillex - Known for his unique blend of dubstep and electro house, Skrillex has had a huge impact on the EDM scene with hits like "Bangarang" and "Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites".
10. Travis Scott - Although he is primarily known as a rapper, Travis Scott has collaborated with numerous EDM artists and has incorporated electronic elements into his music, making him a popular act in the EDM scene.

Of course, this is just a small sampling of the many talented artists in the EDM scene today. Other notable mentions include Kygo, RL Grime, Alison Wonderland, and San Holo, to name a few.

instruction: Provide a dot point list of six different games I can play with a pack of cards.
response:
Here are six games that you could play with a standard deck of playing cards:
- Poker
- Bridge
- Snap
- Blackjack
- Hearts
- Canasta
generated_response:
Sure! Here are six different games you can play with a standard deck of 52 playing cards:

1. Poker: This classic card game involves betting and trying to make the best possible hand with your cards. You can play Texas Hold'em, Omaha, or any other variant of poker you like.

2. Blackjack: In this popular casino game, you try to get a hand value closest to 21 without going over. You can play against the dealer or against other players.

3. Hearts: This trick-taking card game is easy to learn and involves trying to avoid taking tricks that contain hearts. It's a great game for all ages.

4. Spades: Similar to Hearts, Spades is another popular trick-taking card game where you try to bid on the number of tricks you think you can take.

5. Rummy: This classic card game involves laying down sets and runs of cards to earn points. You can play with two or more players.

6. Crazy Eights: In this simple card game, players try to get rid of all their cards by matching the current card on the discard pile. It's a great game for kids and adults alike.
